summary: This is a New York State Sex Offender Registry record for Jeffrey E. Epstein, detailing his registration information, conviction details, vehicles, addresses, and communications with law enforcement agencies. It shows his status as a registered sex offender with multiple state notifications. This document is a log from the New York eJusticeNY Integrated Justice Portal detailing numerous notifications and communications related to Jeffrey Epstein's sex offender registration status between 2011 and 2017. It shows repeated notifications sent to and received from various state and territorial sex offender registries, primarily in the U.S. Virgin Islands, Florida, and New Mexico.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was convicted on June 30, 2008, for sex offenses involving victims aged 14 and 16 years old.
Epstein's sentence included 6 months of probation and time served, with a maximum expiration date of July 21, 2010.
The registry shows Epstein had multiple vehicles registered in Florida, New York, New Mexico, and the Virgin Islands, including luxury vehicles and aircraft.
Epstein was registered as a sex offender in multiple jurisdictions including New York, Florida, Virgin Islands, and New Mexico, with regular notifications sent to these agencies.
The document indicates Epstein used multiple messaging services including Signal, Confide, and WhatsApp.

The document shows extensive and repeated notifications regarding Jeffrey Epstein's sex offender status sent to the U.S. Virgin Islands Department of Justice Sex Offender Registry between 2012 and 2017.
Notifications were also sent to sex offender registries in Florida and New Mexico, indicating multi-state registration requirements.
The log includes annual verification processes, change notifications, and photo due letters, demonstrating ongoing compliance monitoring.
The document was accessed or printed on December 10, 2018, from the New York eJusticeNY Integrated Justice Portal.
A note on page 13 warns that the registry information is for official purposes only and may not be shared with the public.
